Class VectorHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • VectorHelper

  • public class VectorHelper
extends java.lang.Object

    VectorHelper

    The VectorHelper class contains several static methods to simplify many Integer vectors' operations: Sorting, Addition of two vectors, Reverse elements, Get max and min, Apply a function to every element

    Since:
    2017-10-14

      • trierVector

        public static void trierVector(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> t)
        This method is used to sort a Vector
        Parameters:
        t - it's the Vector to sort ( will contain the result )

      • sumVectors

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> sumVectors(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> vect1,
                                                             java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> vect2)
        This method is used to sum all the elements of two vectors and return a new vector that contains the result. Note: The type of the two vectors is Integer and they must have the same size.
        Parameters:
        vect1 - This is the first vector
        vect2 - This is the second vector
        Returns:
        A Vector that contains the result.

      • inverserVector

        public static void inverserVector(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> t)
        This method is used to reverse a Vector
        Parameters:
        t - it's the Vector to reverse ( will contain the result )

      • getMinAndMax

        public static java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> getMinAndMax(java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> vector)
        This method get the minimum and the maximum value from a vector
        Parameters:
        vector - A Vector vector
        Returns:
        A Vector which the first element contains the Min value and the second element [1] contains the Max value
